job_description:
Senior Business Analyst

Key Responsibilities

  • Lead requirement workshops, client calls, and discovery discussions to understand business needs clearly.
  • Ask deeper questions, challenge assumptions, and validate the true business intent behind every requirement.
  • Convert ambiguous client inputs into structured, logical, and actionable functional understanding.
  • Break large features into modules, workflows, components, and clear dependencies.
  • Build strong system-level understanding involving APIs, integrations, data flow, and backend considerations.
  • Translate business processes into functional logic that development teams can execute.
  • Decompose requirements into use-case flows, system behaviours, edge cases, alternate paths, validation rules, and dependencies.
  • Prepare high-quality documentation, including BRD, FRD, SRS, workflows, state diagrams, data-flow diagrams, API requirement specs, and acceptance criteria.
  • Ensure all documentation is clear, logical, structured, testable, and ready for developers and QA to use.
  • Collaborate closely with developers, architects, QA, and product owners to validate feasibility and align understanding.
  • Ensure QA teams can derive test cases effectively from your functional logic and acceptance criteria.
  • Communicate confidently with clients, handle requirement discussions smoothly, and clarify misunderstandings immediately.
  • Push back politely on unclear or changing requirements and ensure final decisions are documented properly.
  • Maintain requirement traceability throughout the lifecycle and ensure zero ambiguity during handover to development.
  • Own the entire requirement lifecycle from discovery to development readiness with high accountability.
  • Drive clarity across teams by ensuring every requirement is complete, validated, and logically consistent.

Required Skills & Experience

  • Minimum 4+ years of core Business Analyst experience with strong analytical and system-level thinking.
  • Ability to break down complex requirements into clear components, workflows, and functional logic.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication with confidence in client interactions and clarifications.
  • Proven experience in preparing SRS, BRD, FRD, workflows, and acceptance criteria with high clarity.
  • Ability to challenge assumptions politely, ask the right questions, and ensure zero ambiguity.
  • Strong collaboration experience with development, QA, architects, and cross-functional teams.
  • Understanding of API behaviours, integrations, data flows, and multi-module system interactions.
  • Ability to run requirement discussions, workshops, and independently lead discovery sessions.
  • Exposure to SaaS, scalable products, automation, or AI-supported systems is an added advantage.
  • Demonstrated ownership of requirements end-to-end, ensuring developer-ready and testable outputs.
  • Not suitable for UI-only thinkers, passive communicators, template-based writers, or those relying on AI for answers.
  • Success is defined by clear, testable requirements, zero rework, strong cross-team alignment, and confident communication.
  • Candidates must align with 2Base’s structured thinking, clarity-driven culture, and transformation of the BA function.

Minimum Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Business, or related field
  • 4 to 8 years of experience as a Business Analyst or Product Analyst
  • Experience in SaaS or scalable product environments
  • Exposure to AI/Automation, integrations, or multi-module systems
  • Ability to run independent client workshops
  • Must have independently handled requirement ownership for at least one full project lifecycle

Benefits

  • A growth-driven environment with opportunities to lead, innovate, and upskill continuously.

Contact: For applications, email your resume to careers@2basetechnologies.com.
summary: Senior Business Analyst translates complex requirements into structured functional logic, ensuring testable outputs and cross-team alignment. Requires 4+ years of experience in SaaS environments with strong system-level thinking.

job_description:
Senior DevSecOps Engineer

We are seeking a Senior DevSecOps Engineer to lead cybersecurity, infrastructure automation, and DevSecOps practices as we transition to a secure, scalable, and modern engineering environment. This role is responsible for strengthening 2Base’s security posture, modernizing pipelines, and fostering a secure-by-design culture. You will collaborate with engineering, product, and leadership teams to ensure systems, applications, and cloud environments are secure, reliable, and future-ready.

Key Responsibilities

  • Define, implement, and enforce security standards, policies, and best practices across cloud and on-prem environments.
  • Conduct security risk assessments, vulnerability scans, penetration testing, and execute mitigation plans.
  • Architect and enhance secure CI/CD pipelines with automated compliance and governance checkpoints.
  • Promote a "Security First" culture across engineering teams, ensuring secure design and development practices.
  • Monitor, detect, investigate, and respond to security threats, incidents, breaches, and anomalies.
  • Develop Infrastructure-as-Code (IaC) practices using Terraform, Ansible, and automation frameworks.
  • Design secure cloud architectures across AWS, Azure, or GCP for scalable, compliant deployments.
  • Build and secure containerized environments with Docker and Kubernetes, enforcing security baselines.
  • Implement secure monitoring, logging, SIEM, and alerting systems for infrastructure and applications.
  • Improve system reliability, scalability, performance, and fault tolerance across critical workloads.
  • Mentor DevOps engineers in secure development, automation, and operational excellence.
  • Lead technical strategy, tool selection, process improvements, and DevSecOps roadmap execution.
  • Collaborate with BA, PM, and Engineering teams to align security, performance, and delivery goals.

Required Skills & Experience

  • 4–8 years of experience in DevOps, Cloud, or Infrastructure engineering with security exposure.
  • Hands-on CI/CD tools: Jenkins, GitLab CI, GitHub Actions.
  • Expertise in AWS, Azure, or GCP with secure architecture focus.
  • Proficiency in Infrastructure-as-Code (Terraform, Ansible).
  • Experience securing Docker and Kubernetes environments.
  • Strong networking knowledge: LAN/WAN, firewalls, VPN, load balancers.
  • Familiarity with security frameworks (OWASP, NIST, CIS Benchmarks).
  • Experience with monitoring/logging tools: Prometheus, Grafana, ELK, CloudWatch, SIEM.
  • Scripting skills: Python, Bash, Shell.
  • Excellent troubleshooting, analytical, and communication skills.

Preferred Qualifications

  • Diploma/B.Tech/MCA in IT, CS, or MCA.
  • Experience in SOC operations or SIEM/SOAR tools.
  • Certifications: AWS Security/DevOps Engineer – Professional, CKS, CEH, CompTIA Security+.

Benefits

  • Growth-driven environment with leadership, innovation, and upskilling opportunities.

Contact: Share your resume at careers@2basetechnologies.com.
summary: Lead cybersecurity and infrastructure automation as a Senior DevSecOps Engineer, ensuring secure, scalable environments through DevSecOps practices and cloud technologies.

About Lean Transition Solutions (LTS)

Lean Transition Solutions (LTS) is a global Operational Excellence and Lean Industry 4.0 software company headquartered in the UK. For over a decade, we’ve helped large organizations turn strategy into action by combining Lean thinking, leadership principles, and modern, scalable technology. We are proud to be trusted by leading global organizations, supporting them in building sustainable, people-centric transformation at scale. With teams across India, Europe, the US, the Middle East, and Mexico, we operate as one connected global team. At LTS, we believe technology strengthens people, enabling them to do their best work. That belief shapes our products, our culture, and how we work together.

Role Overview

The Lead Developer (PHP) will be responsible for leading the design, development, and maintenance of PHP-based applications. This role involves hands-on development, technical decision-making, and mentoring team members while delivering scalable, high-quality solutions for international manufacturing clients based on Industry 4.0 and Lean concepts.

Key Responsibilities

1. Technical Leadership & Architecture

  • Lead end-to-end application architecture using PHP and modern frameworks
  • Design scalable, maintainable solutions that translate complex manufacturing requirements into robust technical implementations
  • Drive technical decision-making across the development lifecycle
  • Establish and enforce coding standards, best practices, and design patterns
  • Champion code quality through comprehensive reviews and architectural guidance

2. Advanced PHP Development

  • Architect and build sophisticated web applications leveraging PHP's full capabilities
  • Develop clean, efficient, and thoroughly tested code following SOLID principles
  • Design and optimize complex database schemas and queries for high-performance data operations
  • Integrate multiple backend services, APIs, and data sources seamlessly
  • Refactor and modernize legacy codebases for improved performance and maintainability

3. Team Development & Mentorship

  • Mentor and upskill junior and mid-level developers in PHP best practices
  • Conduct thorough code reviews with constructive, educational feedback
  • Foster a culture of continuous learning and technical excellence
  • Share knowledge through documentation, presentations, and pair programming
  • Support career growth and technical development of team members

4. Problem Solving & Optimization

  • Diagnose and resolve complex performance bottlenecks and architectural challenges
  • Implement proactive monitoring and debugging strategies
  • Optimize application performance, database queries, and system resources
  • Apply critical thinking to balance technical debt against feature delivery
  • Identify opportunities for automation and process improvement

5. Collaborative Delivery & DevOps

  • Partner closely with Product, QA, UI/UX, and DevOps teams
  • Participate actively in Agile/Scrum ceremonies and sprint planning
  • Ensure solutions align with customer needs and business objectives
  • Support CI/CD pipeline development and deployment automation

6. Innovation & Continuous Improvement

  • Stay current with PHP ecosystem evolution and emerging web technologies
  • Evaluate and recommend new frameworks, tools, and approaches
  • Drive adoption of modern development practices and tooling
  • Contribute to technical strategy and platform roadmap decisions

Preferred Skills & Required Experience

  • Minimum 5+ years of professional PHP development experience
  • 3+ years in a technical lead or senior developer capacity
  • Proven track record delivering complex, production-grade web applications

Technical Skills

  • Expert-level proficiency in PHP (7.4+/8.x) and Object-Oriented Programming
  • Deep hands-on experience with modern PHP frameworks: Symfony (highly preferred), Laravel, CodeIgniter, or similar MVC frameworks
  • Advanced knowledge of relational databases (MySQL/MariaDB/PostgreSQL), complex query optimization, and performance tuning
  • Database design and normalization, transaction management, and data integrity
  • Strong command of HTML5, CSS3, and JavaScript
  • Experience with RESTful API design and development
  • Proficiency with Git and collaborative development workflows
  • Understanding of design patterns and architectural principles

Additional Technical Skills

  • Frontend framework experience (React) - highly valued
  • Experience with Composer and PHP package management
  • Knowledge of unit testing frameworks (PHPUnit)
  • Familiarity with Docker and containerization
  • Cloud platform experience (AWS)
  • Understanding of DevOps practices and CI/CD pipelines
  • Experience with queue systems (RabbitMQ, Redis) - advantageous
  • Knowledge of Agile/Scrum methodologies

Why You’ll Love Working With Us

  • Meaningful Work with Global Impact: Contribute to enterprise platforms used by world-class organizations such as Philips, Hitachi, Pfizer, and other global leaders—helping them improve how they operate, lead, and grow.
  • People-First, Collaborative Culture: Your ideas are heard, your work is valued, and you’re supported by a team built on trust and respect.
  • Purpose-Driven Technology: Build practical, thoughtful products that solve real operational and leadership challenges.
  • Growth & Ownership: Learn continuously, take ownership of your work, and grow your career in a supportive environment.
  • Global Exposure, Human Connection: Work with diverse teams and enterprise clients worldwide—while feeling connected and supported.
  • Quality, Security & Trust: Our platforms and processes are backed by internationally recognized ISO certifications, reflecting our strong commitment to quality, data security, and operational reliability. This means you work in an environment built on high standards and trust.

Build a Strong Future Together

At LTS, we don’t just deliver solutions—we build long-term relationships. Together, we create a strong, sustainable future for our people, our clients, and our organization. From continuous learning and career development opportunities to meaningful ownership in your work, we support you at every stage of your journey. Our people benefit from a supportive work environment, competitive benefits, and a culture that values balance, trust, and long-term success.

Contact Information

Interested candidates may forward their detailed resume to careers@ltslean.com and include the following information in the email content: - Current CTC - Expected CTC - Notice Period - Current Location - Total Relevant Experience - Willingness to work at office
summary: Lead Developer (PHP) at Lean Transition Solutions leads design and development of scalable applications for international clients, mentoring teams and delivering high-quality solutions aligned with Lean and Industry 4.0 principles.

Module No: 2306, Third Floor, Yamuna, Tower II, Technopark Phase III, SEZ Campus, Trivandrum, Kerala, 695581 Website: http://www.techversantinfotech.com Closing Date: 13, Jan 2026 Job Published: 31, Dec 2025 Contact Email: careers@techversantinfotech.com

About Techversant

Techversant is a global technology services and solutions company with 17+ years of experience delivering end-to-end IT solutions. We specialize in Digital Transformation, AI, Blockchain, and mobile/web development, serving diverse industries globally.

What’s Important to Us

We seek a skilled Lead - Automation Test Engineer with 4+ years of hands-on automation experience. Key qualities include technical expertise in test automation frameworks, strong communication, leadership, and collaborative problem-solving.

Key Responsibilities

  • Design, develop, and maintain automated test scripts for web, mobile, and API testing.
  • Collaborate with developers, QA, and product teams to ensure high-quality releases.
  • Execute automated/manual tests for functionality, performance, and reliability.
  • Integrate test suites into CI/CD pipelines (Jenkins, GitHub Actions, Azure DevOps).
  • Analyze test failures, report defects with detailed logs, and improve test coverage.
  • Mentor junior team members and share automation best practices.

Preferred Skills

  • Minimum 6 years of software testing experience (manual + automation).
  • Minimum 4 years with automation tools: Playwright, Selenium, Cypress, Appium, TestNG, Postman, RestAssured, Robot Framework, Katalon Studio.
  • Proficiency in Java, JavaScript/TypeScript, Python, or C#.
  • Strong understanding of QA methodologies, SDLC/STLC, and defect management.
  • Experience with CI/CD pipelines, Git/GitHub, and Test Management tools (TestRail, Zephyr, Azure Test Plans).
  • Exposure to API testing, Agile/Scrum environments, and performance tools (JMeter, LoadRunner).
  • Cloud-based testing (AWS, Azure, Docker) is a plus.

Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, IT, or related fields.

What We Offer

  • Career growth and exposure to cutting-edge technologies.
  • Fixed weekday schedule with weekends off.
  • Family medical insurance and performance-based leave encashment.
  • Long-term growth opportunities in a collaborative, fun environment.
  • Employee rewards, bonuses for training/certifications, and innovation.
  • Work-life balance: flexible timings, early-out Fridays, social/cultural activities.
  • Company-sponsored international tours.
summary: Lead Automation Test Engineer with 6+ years of experience in software testing and automation tools. Requires leadership skills and collaboration in Agile environments, offering career growth and a supportive work culture.

job_description:
Senior AI/ML Engineer

Company: Techversant Infotech (P) Ltd Location: Module No:2306, Third Floor, Yamuna, Tower II, Technopark Phase III, SEZ Campus, Trivandrum, Kerala, 695581 Website: Techversant Infotech Closing Date: 13, Jan 2026 Published Date: 31, Dec 2025 Contact Email: careers@techversantinfotech.com

About Techversant

Techversant is a global IT solutions provider with 17+ years of expertise in Digital Transformation, AI, Blockchain, and cross-platform development. They serve global clients with end-to-end solutions across ColdFusion, Python, Java, .NET, Node.js, and emerging technologies.

Key Responsibilities

  • Develop ML/Deep Learning solutions for predictive modeling, classification, and optimization.
  • Design Generative AI systems (LLMs, diffusion models) for text/code/multimodal use cases.
  • Build scalable recommendation engines using collaborative/content-based filtering.
  • Deploy ML pipelines in cloud environments (AWS, GCP, Azure) with MLOps practices.
  • Own the ML lifecycle: feature engineering, deployment, CI/CD, monitoring, and iteration.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to align AI solutions with business goals.

Preferred Skills

  • 4+ years of production ML/DL experience.
  • Proficiency in Python (OOP, optimization, multi-threading).
  • Hands-on with PyTorch/TensorFlow/Keras and Hugging Face Transformers.
  • Cloud expertise: AWS SageMaker, GCP Vertex AI, Azure ML.
  • Experience with MLOps (MLflow, Kubeflow), orchestration (Airflow), and APIs (FastAPI).
  • Strong understanding of transformer architectures and deep learning.
  • Generative AI model development (LLMs, diffusion models).
  • Familiarity with vector search (FAISS, Pinecone) and multimodal models.

Technical Stack

  • Languages: Python (OOP), Java/.NET
  • ML/DL Frameworks: Scikit-learn, XGBoost, PyTorch, TensorFlow, Hugging Face
  • Cloud/MLOps: AWS/GCP/Azure, Docker, Kubernetes, MLflow
  • Data/Compute: Spark, BigQuery, S3, EC2
  • GenAI Tools: LangChain, OpenAI APIs, Gemini

Preferred Qualifications

  • Experience with RAG, embedding stores, or agent-based orchestration (LangGraph).
  • Open-source contributions in AI/ML/GenAI.
  • Certifications in cloud ML platforms (AWS/GCP/Azure).

Education

  • B.Tech/M.Tech/Ph.D. in CS, AI, Data Science, or equivalent practical experience.

What We Offer

  • Career growth with exposure to cutting-edge technologies.
  • Fixed weekday schedule (weekends off).
  • Family medical insurance and performance-based leave benefits.
  • International tours, employee rewards, and bonus programs.
  • Flexible work timings, early-out Fridays, and cultural activities.
  • Work-life balance with opportunities for training and certifications.
summary: Senior AI/ML Engineer with 4+ years in production ML/DL, Generative AI, and cloud deployment. Offers global exposure, career growth, and flexible work-life balance.

Company: Techversant Infotech (P) Ltd Location: Module No:2306, Third Floor, Yamuna, Tower II, Technopark Phase III, SEZ Campus, Trivandrum, Kerala, 695581 Website: http://www.techversantinfotech.com Closing Date: 13, Jan 2026 Published: 31, Dec 2025 Contact Email: careers@techversantinfotech.com

About Techversant

Techversant is a global IT solutions provider with 17+ years of experience in Digital Transformation, AI, Blockchain, and mobile development. They serve global clients with expertise in Python, Java, .NET, React Native, and more.

Role Overview

We seek a Senior Data Scientist to lead advanced data systems for analytics, machine learning, and business intelligence. The ideal candidate combines data engineering and science expertise to deliver strategic insights.

Key Responsibilities

  • Mine and extract usable data from diverse sources
  • Optimize classifiers using machine learning tools
  • Preprocess structured/unstructured data
  • Enhance data collection procedures
  • Cleanse and validate data integrity
  • Analyze large datasets to identify patterns
  • Develop predictive models and ML algorithms
  • Present results clearly to stakeholders
  • Propose solutions for business challenges
  • Collaborate with Business and IT teams

Preferred Skills

  • Programming: Python, R, SQL, Hive, Pig; Scala/Java/C++ advantageous
  • Statistics: Applied statistical methods (regression, hypothesis testing)
  • Machine Learning: KNN, Naive Bayes, SVM, Decision Forests
  • Math Skills: Multivariable calculus, linear algebra
  • Data Wrangling: Handling imperfect datasets
  • Visualization: Matplotlib, ggplot, Tableau, D3.js
  • Communication: Articulate findings to technical/non-technical audiences
  • Tools: Data science frameworks, software engineering practices
  • Education: Degree in Computer Science/Engineering preferred
  • Experience: Proven track record as Data Scientist/Analyst

What We Offer

  • Career growth & tech exposure
  • Fixed weekday schedule (weekends off)
  • Family medical insurance
  • Performance-based leave benefits
  • Long-term growth opportunities
  • Collaborative, experienced team
  • Employee rewards programs
  • Training/certification bonuses
  • Work-life balance (flexible hours, early out Fridays)
  • Company-sponsored international tours
